page.title: 16The Glenogil Gamekeeper
page.content: Pheasant chicks are brought to the estate in early July and are krpt in pens. The keeper sees that the chicks are fed and watered, given adequate shelter and protected from predators. The young pheasants are fed on various types of grain and special pellets which contain vitamins to ensure their healthy growth. when the young birds are strong and mature they are released onto the estate but the keeper continues to feed them to keep them healthy and to ensure that they remain on the estate. When the shooting season starts, beaters are hired to drive the birds out of cover towards the guns.The guns are lined up at good firing points. Gun-dogs, mainly trained by the keepers, retrieve the shot birds and each gun is credited with the number of birds he has brought down.
